etymologies: late Middle English: from hedge(from its habitat) + hog (from its piglike snout)

definitions: a small nocturnal Old World mammal with a spiny coat and short legs, able to roll itself into a ball for defense.

notes.text: Family Erinaceidae: four genera and several species, including the common hedgehog (Erinaceus europaeus) of western and northern Europe, which is predominantly insectivorous

shortDefinitions: nocturnal insectivorous Old World mammal with spiny coat and short legs

definitions: any other animal covered with spines, especially a porcupine.
